pullRequest.body:
Defines the residue field of a point of a locally ringed space and the corresponding evaluation map.

---

### PR summary [06d744b82d](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14302/commits/06d744b82dd102f3ba79300433c4faf31f6f22e4)

#### Import changes

No significant changes to the import graph

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ evaluation`
`+ evaluation_eq_zero_iff_not_mem_basicOpen`
`+ evaluation_naturality`
`+ evaluation_naturality_apply`
`+ evaluation_ne_zero_iff_mem_basicOpen`
`+ instance (x : X) : Field (X.residueField x)`
`+ ker_residue`
`+ residueField`
`+ residueFieldMap`
`+ residueFieldMap_comp`
`+ residueFieldMap_id`
`+ residue_comp_residueFieldMap_eq_stalkMap_comp_residue`
`+ residue_eq_zero_iff`
`+ residue_ne_zero_iff_isUnit`
`+ ΓToStalk_stalkMap`
`+ ΓToStalk_stalkMap_apply`
`+ Γevaluation`
`+ Γevaluation_eq_zero_iff_not_mem_basicOpen`
`+ Γevaluation_naturality`
`+ Γevaluation_naturality_apply`
`+ Γevaluation_ne_zero_iff_mem_basicOpen`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>

Thanks for the quick review @erdOne! An unfortunate side effect of reducing the imports, is that the nice notations you introduced are no longer available. I think we should move these up the import hierarchy.

Thanks!
maintainer merge
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by erdOne.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9772758357/job/26977687871)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9772758357/job/26977688482)
Thanks for the reviews!

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
Please move the file to `Geometry/RingedSpace/LocallyRingedSpace`.

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
Probably we can give it a field instance without diamonds.
I'd reverse this lemma and make it simp.

```suggestion
@[reassoc]
lemma evaluation_naturality {V : Opens Y} (x : f ⁻¹ᵁ V) :
```

```suggestion
lemma ker_residue : RingHom.ker (residue R) = maximalIdeal R :=
```
Do you think these should be simp lemmas?
Probably makes sense.
Why is this necessary? I think everything `LocallyRingedSpace`-related should be in `Geometry/RingedSpace/OpenImmersion`.
We should split this file and move the `LocallyRingedSpace` adjunction away... (not in this PR)
Or the real problem is that this def doesn't belong here.
maybe `evaluation_eq_zero_iff_not_mem_basicOpen` as simp instead.
Instead or additionally?
I thought lint was complaining that the LHS is not simpNF as `ne_eq` rewrites it to `\not _ = _`
No, it's only complaining for the `Γ` version, because it rewrites with `Γ_obj`.
Ah okay. `evaluation_eq_zero_iff_not_mem_basicOpen` can still be added as simp lemma though. And then this lemma would be provable by simp.
Should I still keep the `evaluation_ne_zero_iff_mem_basicOpen` version?

I kind of believe that `evaluation_eq_zero_iff_not_mem_basicOpen` and `evaluation_ne_zero_iff_mem_basicOpen` (and their `Γ`-counterparts) are the only `evaluation_*_zero_iff_*` lemmas worth keeping here, since `mem_basicOpen` should currently be our simpNF of this concept.
Not 100% sure though. Will need to use this API more to find out, but this is my gut feeling.
I _thought_ I did use the `mem_maximalIdeal` versions somewhere in my application, but turns out I did not. So I am happy to remove them.

Even if you did, I believe you should do that in two rewrites (or `A.trans B.symm`). It is more manageable for both mathlib and users if there is one canonical way to spell everything. This leads to n rewrite lemmas for n equivalent spellings instead of n^2, and the user will then always be encouraged to change their arguments into the canonical form, reliably knowing that this where all the API is.
Understood.

```suggestion
def Γevaluation (x : X) : X.presheaf.obj (op ⊤) ⟶ X.residueField x :=
```
Does this make `Γevaluation_eq_zero_iff_not_mem_basicOpen` a valid simp lemma?
Indeed, good catch. Changed.
Do we really want this to be a simp lemma? (same for `Γevaluation_eq_zero_iff_not_mem_basicOpen`.)
I think we should choose a simpNF. Do you think `X.evaluation x f = 0` would be better?
Ok, let us keep these simp lemmas.
Could you also include a lemma which relates `stalkMap f x` and `evaluationMap f x`, and lemmas `evaluationMap_id` and `evaluationMap_comp`?
(Also, I am not sure about the name "evaluationMap"; do not you feel that `mapResidueField` would be better?)
`residueFieldMap` (in accordance with `stalkMap`) maybe?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(AlgebraicGeometry): residue field of a point and evaluation
